Posts.Content: I am so sorry you're going through this!  However, your question should be put to your oncologist not this forum.  We can offer comfort and practical assistance not medical advice! xx.  Report

Posts.Title: I like Arimidex

Posts.Content: Sarah, I'm so sorry you're going through this! Please try to be gentle with yourself as much as you can be; and if you have someone close to you that you can confide in that can provide you with comfort, please know that you need to share this!  No one can be strong without help! Please let me know how you do.  Am praying for you! Report 1 Thank you, i just wish the letter would hurry up and arrive so i can make an appointment im so worrid of been messed about again as i said i was referred for a ultra sound but radiology cancelled but when they cancelled it they didnt follow protocol and inform my doctors to refer me to breast clinic they just put it in the note but didnt follow it  though so my doctors have made a complain about it but that was 3 weeks of waiting for nothing now back to waiting. Ive googled everything possible, im more scared for my kids i cant leave them yet there to young thats all that keeps me going im trying to be very mentaly strong just in case they say its cancer as i will fight with everything i have but im also trying to keep in mind it mostly likly is something less sinister, i think its because doctors have actually said she needs breast clinic for breast cancer rule out it shocked me abit. hope you are well. Report Hi Sarah, It's good to hear back from you! I understand that you're doing all you can do to stay strong now! I'll keep praying for you.  Please let me know what happens! xx  Report 1
Posts.Title: im really scared and no one to talk to

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah, I can understand what you're going through!  But please remember that finding out what's going on will take some time. The waiting is necessary, because the doctors will know more after they see you and possibly do tests.  The results will let them respond appropriately. Try not to lose heart!  Be good to yourself and take it easy, as much as you can.  We're here for you! x Report
Posts.Title: im really scared and no one to talk to

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah, It's good to hear back from you! I understand that you're doing all you can do to stay strong now! I'll keep praying for you.  Please let me know what happens! xx  Report 1
Posts.Title: im really scared and no one to talk to

Posts.Content: Hi Tina, I understand!  I got lots of support from this site!  When I got diagnosed last year, and had my hysterectomy, my family knew, of course, and a couple of close friends.  I kept my meltdowns mostly between myself and my husband--he was a great support.   But there were times when it felt so good just to get on this site and share experiences with others.  When someone can say, "I've been there, too, and you're not acting foolish, you're just scared to death! I came through this, and you will, too. " It means more than I can say! Please let me know the results of your blood tests!  I'm here for you!  xxx Lynda   Report 1

Good for you for persevering! Hopefully, pursuing your thyrod function and hormone levels will provide you with some more good information, too. Posts.Title: Lymph nodes/breast lumps

Posts.Content: Hi Tina, Thanks for the update. I'm surprised that hematology didn't do inflation markers! Please let me know when you get your bloods done again. Are you in the UK?  I don't know much about the public health system there, I'm in the US. Is there some way that your doctor can fast track or hurry up this screening process?  Does she know someone she can call on to get the CT scan and the bloods done faster?  It seems to me that you need to know what's going on with you--as soon as possible and that waiting patiently in the que isn't what needs to be done right now... Also, it seems to me that you might want to start posting on this site in the lymphoma discussion group if there is one!  I'm sure that you will be able to find good information there!   Please stay as positive as you can, but don't hesitate to go to A&E if you start feeling poorly!   Also, know that you're in my thoughts and prayers, Tina, I know that this is a terrible time for you! xxx (((BIG HUG)))     Report
Posts.Title: Lymph nodes/breast lumps

Posts.Content: Hi Sonja, I'm sorry that you had to go through all that.  But, as you said, you are now stronger!  I also hope that you are much happier!   Sometimes life hands you these situations and the people who have said that they love you and promised to be with you through thick and thin flee faster than lightening strikes. I like to think of it as though the Universe has taken out the garbage for you! I'm sure what you went through was horrible-- But now you know that you are brave and strong and deserve someone who's the same! xxx Lynda Report

Posts.Title: Lymph nodes/breast lumps

Posts.Content: Hi Tina, Well, good news and troubling news! I'd suggest that when you get a quiet momet you could write down your questions after reviewing the CT report and get another appointment with her, to talk over the results.  It seems to me that she is thinking that you might have a localized infection or irritation in the larger mass, perhaps a node that for some reason was unable to drain?   I think that you're doing all you can do right now...which is pursuing your goal of finding out what's going on.  And, it's a good goal.  Keep on refusing to be fobbed off!   Please let me know how you're getting on! xx  Report
Posts.Title: Lymph nodes/breast lumps

Posts.Content: Sorry this is happening to you.  The gyn is being careful, more careful that the surgeon.  It is possible that a needle biopsy could miss cancerous cells.  They are microscopic after all.  I would suggest that you get your gyn to refer you to an oncologist for a consultation.  Remember, not only do you have a complex adenoma, you also have hyperplasia and calcifications.  This is something that a surgeon would know relatively little about, but an oncologist would.   If there is any possibility of cancer, I myself would want it removed. Best of luck to you. xx Report
Posts.Title: complex fibroadenoma vs cancer

Posts.Content: I was offered arimidex by my surgeon/oncologist after surgery for endometrial cancer last year.  I didn't have to do anything, really, as I was staged at 1A.  I took the arimidex for three weeks.  I was very careful, and took partial doses for a few days, until I was at full dosage.  It was hell.  My joints became sore and immobile. My whole body ached. I could barely shuffle 25 feet to the mail box.  I was unable to sleep, full of adrenaline.  I stopped after 3 weeks (I had started taking it in August).  It took until the end of December for the side effects to dissipate! I had done lots of research before starting it.  The drug didn't bother some women.  Others had terrible side effects, worse than mine. a few quit the drug, saying that they'd take the risk of getting cancer again, but in the interim, they'd prefer to have some quality of life.    Report
Posts.Title: Zolodex and Arimidex or Exemestane..

Posts.Content: Hi Marie, Sorry that you're going through this.  But you did the right thing by going to the doctor straightaway.  Most things can be taken care of if they're caught in time. If you can, try to take things one day at a time.  Please know that I'll keep you in my thoughts and prayers.  Let me know how you get on! xx Report
Posts.Title: Very worried

Posts.Content: I would suggest you go back to your doctor and tell her you have a family history of breast cancer, if she doesn't already know.  Because of your family history, it's best to investigate what's going on sooner rather than later, I think. Best of luck to you, please let me know how you get on.   Report

Posts.Content: Sorry you're going through this.  Even if you post a picture, no one on this site can give you a medical diagnosis--we're not doctors.  Please go heck with your doctor.  Most anything can be helped if caught in time.  Best of luck to you. xx Report
